intro: Euploca laxa, commonly known as the narrowleaf euploca, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and typically grows in wetland or marshy environments. The plant features slender, erect stems with opposite, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its showy, tubular flowers are usually pink or purple and bloom in late spring to early summer. Euploca laxa is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in supporting local wildlife.
